conclusion: Determine when particles A and B meet by analyzing their motion using the velocity-time graph.
Graph shows velocity of particles A and B as a function of time.
Particle A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2v0 at t0, then decreases linearly to 0 at 3t0.
Particle B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to v0 at 2t0, remains constant until 4t0, and then decreases linearly to 0 at 6t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle A from 0 to t0 as v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle A from t0 to 3t0 as 2v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by A from 0 to 3t0 is 3v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 0 to 2t0 as v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 2t0 to 4t0 as 2v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 4t0 to 6t0 as v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by B from 0 to 6t0 is 4v0 t0.
Particles A and B meet when they have traveled the same distance, which occurs at 5t0.
Particles A and B meet at t = 5t0.
